perturbation.changed_text:
11. The Term of this Agreement will commence on the date above, and shall
         continue for a term of one (1) year. mPhase shall have the right to
         annually renew this agreement for a period of one year upon each annual
         expiration with the written consent of Lucent, which written consent
         shall not be unreasonably withheld. Either party wishing to terminate
         the Agreement must give written notice to the other party at least
         thirty (30) days prior to the desired date of termination. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Lucent may terminate this agreement at any time, without cause, with no prior notice.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict in the termination clause. The original text requires a 30-day notice for termination by either party. The added sentence allows Lucent to terminate the agreement at any time without notice or cause. This creates uncertainty about the actual termination procedure and rights of mPhase.

perturbation.changed_text:
7.       Lucent is generally aware of the current quality of mPhase's Goods.
         mPhase agrees to maintain the quality of its Goods associated with the
         Lucent Co-Branding Logo to a level of quality comparable to the current
         quality of their Goods.
8.       If Lucent determines, at its sole discretion, that mPhase's Goods are no longer maintained at
         an acceptable level of quality, whether or not comparable to the current level, Lucent shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately without notice. No written notification is required.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict regarding quality control and termination. Originally, Lucent had to notify mPhase in writing if the goods' quality declined. The modification removes the notification requirement, allows Lucent to use 'acceptable level' as a criterion (which may not be tied to the current quality) and makes the termination immediate and discretionary. This contradicts the original intent of a collaborative quality maintenance process.

perturbation.changed_text:
1.       mPhase may apply the logo shown on Schedule A of this
         Agreement (the "Lucent Co-Branding Logo"} in Approved Uses for mPhase's
         Goods, subject to Lucent's prior written approval, which may be granted or withheld at Lucent's sole discretion. 
2.       mPhase agrees to abide by the guidelines appearing on Schedule B of
         this Agreement specifying the dimensions, requirements and
         specifications, and the review process related to use of the Lucent
         Co-Branding Logo. However, Lucent reserves the right to modify or waive any of the guidelines in Schedule B at any time without prior notice to mPhase.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces uncertainty in the logo usage rights. The original contract specifies using the *exact* logo in Schedule A. The modified contract adds a layer of approval at Lucent's discretion. Also, while mPhase agrees to Schedule B guidelines, Lucent can waive/modify them without notice. This creates a contradiction: mPhase must follow Schedule B, but Schedule B can change arbitrarily, undermining the original agreement and creating an unequal power dynamic.
